column4: I had the same problem once also. I called alsamixer and was able to get rid of the error.
what do you mean
I mean what I said. Can you be more specific.
Specific about my problem?  What do you mean you called alsamixer
I only have two options in alsamixer
Master and PCM
Shouldn't I have more?
haha
I like this guy
do sudo apt-get install nautilus
sudo apt-get install nautilus
sudo let's you run commands as root
This guy's just messing around lol
alsamixer is a program available in Ubuntu. Just enter 'alsamixer' in a Gnome terminal. It allows you to set many ALSA controls.
I did, I only have two things I can change in it though
man alsamixer will tell you what control settings you can change. --  I am surprised to read that you can change only two control settings.
I only have Master and PCM
There are two Web documents that I can recommend in your situation: http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/Soundkarten_installieren/HDA
http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/Soundprobleme/Audio-Fehler-Beschreibung

http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/Soundprobleme/Audio-Fehler-Beschreibung. But they are in German.
